fields.Title of Contribution: Liberalizing Education?: Measuring Moral Foundations in a Gen-Ed Ethics Course
fields.Description/Abstract: This study compares changes in moral foundations between students taking a required ethics course (experimental group, N=161) and students taking other undergraduate courses (control group, N=141). Using the Moral Foundations Questionnaire in a longitudinal quasi-experiment, this study demonstrated (i) changes in moral foundations are measurable in a required course, (ii) political orientations change along with moral foundations, and (iii) no significant group differences in these trends comparing students in the two groups. The trend across time was an increasing endorsement of fairness and care (“liberal”) foundations and a decreasing endorsement of loyalty, authority, and purity (“conservative”) foundations.
